title: (x) Ideo Eyes Open "London" slab serif caps - Rosewood Fill {Florian}
content:
What's this font? I see this EVERYWHERE lately. The 'LONDON' part.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 3.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20100307220727/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%203_50.png) | 71.79 KB |
author: avenir04

comments.content:
Isn't it odd how often Rosewood Fill shows up, especially without its counterpart (Rosewood Regular)? Not that Rosewood Regular is usable for most jobs, but I would think any decent Clarendon face would be better than the over-spaced Rosewood Fill.

BTW, I just stumbled over it again in Disney's CAMP ROCK logo... with Tiki Island!

<cite>Isn’t it odd</cite>

Well, Rosewood comes [bundled with Adobe software](http://web.archive.org/web/20100307220727/http:/blogs.adobe.com/typblography/CS3fonts.html), Clarendon not. I guess that explains a lot.

_Well, Rosewood comes bundled with Adobe software, Clarendon not. I guess that explains a lot._

No. I don’t agree it does. Rosewood Fill was never meant to be used as a typeface on its own. Doing so was a Carsonish kinda thing to do. And that’s OK. It’s just lame to _still_ do it.
Explain or excuse doesn’t matter. Using Rosewood Fill is a design decision and not a availability decision.

Just have to comment to the topic title.

You saw this everywhere LATELY? Like in the past 6/7/8 years? Sorry.

It is indeed Rosewood Fill– Along the lines of Clarendon. An homage to the woodtype look.  
aprt from this the other most visible stiil remain, Helvetica, Helvetica Neue, San Serif &  
Sabon–Elegant  
Vik  
------  
 [Local Directory](http://web.archive.org/web/20100307220727/http:/ilsmedicalreference.org/)
There seems to have been a hiccup, Erin -- you posted the same identification request [twice](http://web.archive.org/web/20100307220727/http:/typophile.com/node/47503) (see Florian's second comment).

\> _Isn’t it odd how often Rosewood Fill shows up, especially without its counterpart (Rosewood Regular)?_

I made that very same remark a couple of years ago. You are _so_ right. :^D

yes, I must have unintentionally posted it twice :/  
but thanks for the help ... I do now remember that it's Rosewood.  
and when I said I've seen it lately -- that's just because it's come up a lot while I've perused the web, coroflot, etc. (prompting this post)  
I believe starbucks has used it as well.

:)
yeah - Starbucks use it a lot.
